alert.note: Alert for Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 14 at 5:22PM MST until January 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM MST THIS EVENING UNTIL 5 PM MST SUNDAY ABOVE 5500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING ABOVE 5500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 5500 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 15 inches. Winds gusting 30 to 45 mph late tonight and Sunday morning. For the Winter Storm Watch above 5500 feet, heavy snow possible. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 15 inches possible. * WHERE...Areas above 5500 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff and Williams. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 8 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Snow forecast from 8 PM Today to 5 PM Sunday: Doney Park 4 to 8 inches Flagstaff 9 to 13 inches Williams 9 to 13 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
